title: Mark Chapter 10 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Mark chapter 10 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Mark Chapter 10 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Mark Chapter 10.

questions.question: Where did Jesus go after he arose as mentioned in Mark 10:1?
options: The coasts of Judaea by the farther side of Jordan
Galilee
Jerusalem
Nazareth
questions.correctAnswer: The coasts of Judaea by the farther side of Jordan
questions.explanation: Mark 10:1 states that Jesus arose and came into the coasts of Judaea by the farther side of Jordan.

questions.question: What question did the Pharisees ask Jesus in Mark 10:2?
options: Is it lawful for a man to put away his wife?
Who is the greatest in the kingdom of God?
How can one inherit eternal life?
What is the greatest commandment?
questions.correctAnswer: Is it lawful for a man to put away his wife?
questions.explanation: In Mark 10:2, the Pharisees asked Jesus if it was lawful for a man to put away his wife.

questions.question: According to Jesus in Mark 10:6, how did God make humans from the beginning?
options: Male and female
One flesh
Good and evil
Spirit and body
questions.correctAnswer: Male and female
questions.explanation: Mark 10:6 says God made them male and female from the beginning of creation.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'What therefore God hath joined together, let not man ______.'
options: put asunder
judge
divide
ignore
questions.correctAnswer: put asunder
questions.explanation: Mark 10:9 instructs that what God has joined, no man should put asunder.

questions.question: According to Mark 10:11, what sin is committed if a man puts away his wife and marries another?
options: Adultery
Theft
Blasphemy
Idolatry
questions.correctAnswer: Adultery
questions.explanation: Mark 10:11 states that whoever puts away his wife and marries another commits adultery against her.

questions.question: True or False: Jesus was pleased when his disciples rebuked those who brought children to Him (Mark 10:14).
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Mark 10:14 says Jesus was much displeased when His disciples rebuked those bringing children.

questions.question: Who did Jesus say must receive the kingdom of God like a little child? (Mark 10:15)
options: Whosoever shall not
Only adults
The Pharisees
The rich
questions.correctAnswer: Whosoever shall not
questions.explanation: Mark 10:15 teaches that whoever does not receive the kingdom of God as a little child shall not enter it.

questions.question: What did the rich man ask Jesus in Mark 10:17?
options: What shall I do that I may inherit eternal life?
Where is the kingdom of God?
How can I be healed?
Who is the greatest in the kingdom?
questions.correctAnswer: What shall I do that I may inherit eternal life?
questions.explanation: Mark 10:17 describes a man asking Jesus how he may inherit eternal life.

questions.question: What did Jesus tell the rich man to do to have treasure in heaven? (Mark 10:21)
options: Sell all he had and give to the poor
Build a temple
Offer sacrifices
Fast and pray
questions.correctAnswer: Sell all he had and give to the poor
questions.explanation: In Mark 10:21, Jesus told the man to sell his possessions and give to the poor to have treasure in heaven.

questions.question: True or False: Jesus said it is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle than for a rich man to enter the kingdom of God. (Mark 10:25)
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Mark 10:25 clearly states this comparison regarding the difficulty for a rich man to enter God's kingdom.

questions.question: What did Jesus say about those who have left all for his sake and the gospel's in Mark 10:30?
options: They shall receive a hundredfold now and eternal life in the world to come
They shall be forgotten
They shall suffer only
They shall become rulers
questions.correctAnswer: They shall receive a hundredfold now and eternal life in the world to come
questions.explanation: Mark 10:30 promises a hundredfold reward now and eternal life for those who leave all for Jesus and the gospel.

questions.question: Who came to Jesus asking to sit at his right and left hand in glory? (Mark 10:35)
options: James and John, the sons of Zebedee
Peter and Andrew
Philip and Bartholomew
Thomas and Matthew
questions.correctAnswer: James and John, the sons of Zebedee
questions.explanation: Mark 10:35 states that James and John asked Jesus for places of honor in His glory.

questions.question: True or False: Jesus said He came to be ministered to, not to minister. (Mark 10:45)
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Mark 10:45 states that the Son of man came to minister and give His life as a ransom, not to be ministered unto.

questions.question: Who was the blind man Jesus healed near Jericho? (Mark 10:46)
options: Bartimaeus, the son of Timaeus
Lazarus
Nicodemus
Zacchaeus
questions.correctAnswer: Bartimaeus, the son of Timaeus
questions.explanation: Mark 10:46 identifies the blind man as Bartimaeus, son of Timaeus.

questions.question: What did Bartimaeus cry out to Jesus? (Mark 10:47)
options: Jesus, thou Son of David, have mercy on me
Lord, heal me
Master, save me
Son of God, help me
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus, thou Son of David, have mercy on me
questions.explanation: Mark 10:47 records Bartimaeus crying out, 'Jesus, thou Son of David, have mercy on me.'

medium.title: Mark Chapter 10 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Mark Chapter 10 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is struggling with understanding the sanctity of marriage. Based on Mark 10, what biblical truth would you share about marriage?
options: Marriage is a lifelong union instituted by God that should not be broken by man.
Marriage is just a social contract that can be ended by mutual agreement.
Divorce is allowed without any restriction according to God's word.
Marriage is only a temporary arrangement until personal happiness is found.
questions.correctAnswer: Marriage is a lifelong union instituted by God that should not be broken by man.
questions.explanation: Mark 10:6-9 teaches that God made male and female from the beginning and that what God has joined together, no man should put asunder. Jesus emphasizes the permanency and sacredness of marriage.

questions.question: How does Mark 10 teach about forgiving and receiving others, especially children, in the kingdom of God?
options: We should welcome and receive others with the humility and trust of children.
Children should be kept away from religious teaching until they are older.
Only adults are capable of entering the kingdom of God.
The kingdom of God is for those who are strong and self-reliant.
questions.correctAnswer: We should welcome and receive others with the humility and trust of children.
questions.explanation: Mark 10:13-15 shows Jesus welcoming children and teaching that receiving the kingdom of God must be like receiving it as a little child, highlighting humility and trust as key virtues.

questions.question: A believer is anxious about their possessions and wealth. According to Mark 10, what biblical principle should they remember about riches?
options: Riches can hinder entering the kingdom of God and require trust in God rather than wealth.
Wealth guarantees God's favor and entrance into the kingdom.
Riches should be hoarded for personal security.
The more possessions, the closer one is to God.
questions.correctAnswer: Riches can hinder entering the kingdom of God and require trust in God rather than wealth.
questions.explanation: Mark 10:23-27 teaches that it is difficult for the rich to enter God's kingdom and encourages trust in God over riches, underscoring the need for faith and reliance on God.

questions.question: What does Mark 10 teach about generosity and stewardship with possessions?
options: Selling possessions and giving to the poor is a way to gain treasure in heaven.
Keeping possessions for oneself is the best way to ensure security.
Giving to the poor is optional and not related to spiritual life.
Possessions should be used only for personal enjoyment.
questions.correctAnswer: Selling possessions and giving to the poor is a way to gain treasure in heaven.
questions.explanation: Mark 10:21 shows Jesus telling a man to sell all he has and give to the poor to have treasure in heaven, highlighting the importance of generosity and detachment from wealth.

questions.question: When a fellow believer is feeling discouraged about losing earthly treasures for following Christ, what encouragement does Mark 10 provide?
options: Those who leave things for Jesus and the gospel will receive a hundredfold blessing and eternal life.
Losses for Christ have no reward in this life or the next.
It is better to hold on to possessions than to follow Jesus.
Only material wealth matters in God's kingdom.
questions.correctAnswer: Those who leave things for Jesus and the gospel will receive a hundredfold blessing and eternal life.
questions.explanation: Mark 10:29-30 assures believers that sacrifices made for Christ will be rewarded abundantly both now and eternally, encouraging perseverance and faithfulness.

questions.question: According to Mark 10, what attitude should believers have about greatness and leadership in the church?
options: True greatness is shown through serving others humbly, not exercising authority over them.
Greatness is measured by how many people one rules over.
Leaders should seek power and authority for personal gain.
Being served is the mark of a great leader.
questions.correctAnswer: True greatness is shown through serving others humbly, not exercising authority over them.
questions.explanation: Mark 10:42-44 teaches that unlike worldly rulers, believers should seek to be servants and ministers, showing humility and love in leadership.

questions.question: How does Mark 10 illustrate Jesus’ approach to serving others?
options: Jesus came to serve others and give his life as a ransom for many.
Jesus came to be served and exalted.
Jesus avoided serving people to maintain his authority.
Jesus only served those who were important.
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus came to serve others and give his life as a ransom for many.
questions.explanation: Mark 10:45 states that the Son of Man came not to be served but to minister and give his life as a ransom, modeling servant leadership and sacrificial love.

questions.question: A believer is experiencing fear and uncertainty about future trials. What does Mark 10 teach about trusting God's plan during difficult times?
options: With God, all things are possible even when situations seem impossible.
Trials mean God has abandoned you.
You should rely only on your own strength during hardships.
Difficulties have no spiritual purpose.
questions.correctAnswer: With God, all things are possible even when situations seem impossible.
questions.explanation: Mark 10:27 encourages trust in God’s power, reminding believers that what is impossible for man is possible with God, offering hope amid trials.

questions.question: How does Mark 10 instruct believers to respond to those in need, like the blind man Bartimaeus?
options: We should listen to their cries for help and respond with compassion and faith.
Ignore those who beg for help as it is not our responsibility.
Only help those who are part of our community.
Assume their needs are exaggerated and avoid involvement.
questions.correctAnswer: We should listen to their cries for help and respond with compassion and faith.
questions.explanation: Mark 10:46-52 shows Jesus responding to Bartimaeus’ persistent faith and healing him, teaching believers to be compassionate and attentive to those in need.

questions.question: True or False: According to Mark 10, Jesus taught that remarriage after divorce is acceptable without consequences.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Mark 10:11-12 clearly states that whoever divorces and remarries commits adultery, indicating remarriage after divorce is not without spiritual consequences.

questions.question: True or False: Mark 10 teaches that humility and childlike faith are necessary to enter the kingdom of God.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Mark 10:14-15 emphasizes that receiving the kingdom of God must be like receiving it as a little child, highlighting humility and dependent faith as essential.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: According to Mark 10, 'What therefore God hath joined together, let not man ________.'
options: put asunder
separate
break
divide
questions.correctAnswer: put asunder
questions.explanation: Mark 10:9 teaches that man should not put asunder what God has joined together, emphasizing the sacredness and permanence of marriage.

questions.question: A believer wants to follow Jesus fully but is hesitant because of personal sacrifices. What does Mark 10 teach about taking up the cross?
options: Following Jesus requires self-denial, taking up one’s cross, and wholehearted commitment.
Following Jesus is easy and requires no sacrifice.
The cross is only symbolic and not a call to actual suffering.
One can follow Jesus without giving up possessions or comforts.
questions.correctAnswer: Following Jesus requires self-denial, taking up one’s cross, and wholehearted commitment.
questions.explanation: Mark 10:21 instructs the rich man to sell all and take up his cross to follow Jesus, highlighting the cost of discipleship and total commitment.

questions.question: How does Mark 10 guide believers to view authority and leadership in contrast to worldly rulers?
options: God’s kingdom leadership is marked by service and humility, not domineering authority.
Leaders should seek to dominate and control others.
Authority is measured by power and fear.
Ruling others is the goal of Christian leadership.
questions.correctAnswer: God’s kingdom leadership is marked by service and humility, not domineering authority.
questions.explanation: Mark 10:42-44 contrasts worldly rulers with Jesus’ teaching that greatness in His kingdom means being a servant to all.

questions.question: What biblical truth about obedience to God’s commandments does Mark 10 highlight in the interaction with the rich young man?
options: Observing commandments is important, but following Jesus may require further personal sacrifice.
Keeping commandments alone guarantees inheriting eternal life.
Commandments are outdated and unnecessary for salvation.
Good deeds are more important than obedience.
questions.correctAnswer: Observing commandments is important, but following Jesus may require further personal sacrifice.
questions.explanation: Mark 10:19-22 shows the young man kept commandments but lacked willingness to give up possessions and follow Jesus, teaching that obedience involves heart and sacrifice.

hard.title: Mark Chapter 10 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Mark Chapter 10.

questions.question: In Mark 10:6-9, Jesus refers to the creation of male and female and their union in marriage. Which Old Testament passage does this teaching explicitly echo?
options: Genesis 1:27-28
Genesis 2:24
Exodus 20:12
Leviticus 18:22
questions.correctAnswer: Genesis 2:24
questions.explanation: Mark 10:6-9 quotes and builds on Genesis 2:24, emphasizing the original divine institution of marriage as one flesh.

questions.question: What is the significance of Jesus’ statement in Mark 10:27 'With men it is impossible, but not with God: for with God all things are possible' in relation to salvation?
options: It highlights human inability to earn salvation by works
It emphasizes the necessity of wealth for salvation
It shows that salvation is only for the Jewish people
It means that salvation is guaranteed without faith
questions.correctAnswer: It highlights human inability to earn salvation by works
questions.explanation: Jesus teaches that entering the kingdom of God is impossible by human effort alone, but possible through God's power (Mark 10:27).

questions.question: The request of James and John in Mark 10:37 to sit at Jesus’ right and left hand can be understood as a foreshadowing of which Old Testament imagery?
options: The seats of honor at King David’s table
The cherubim guarding the Ark of the Covenant
The two tablets of the Ten Commandments
The two witnesses in Revelation
questions.correctAnswer: The seats of honor at King David’s table
questions.explanation: Their request reflects royal protocol where the right and left hand were places of highest honor, suggesting a desire for authority as in David’s royal court (Mark 10:37).

questions.question: In Mark 10:45, Jesus says the Son of man came 'to give his life a ransom for many.' What Hebrew concept underlies the idea of 'ransom' here?
options: Kopher - a price for redemption
Shalom - peace
Shema - hearing
Torah - law
questions.correctAnswer: Kopher - a price for redemption
questions.explanation: The Greek word 'lutron' (ransom) corresponds to Hebrew 'kopher', meaning a price paid for release or redemption (Mark 10:45).

questions.question: Which literary device is primarily used in Mark 10:31 'But many that are first shall be last; and the last first'?
options: Chiasmus
Parallelism
Metaphor
Alliteration
questions.correctAnswer: Chiasmus
questions.explanation: This verse exhibits a chiastic structure where ‘first’ and ‘last’ are inverted to emphasize reversal of expectations (Mark 10:31).

questions.question: In the cultural context of Mark 10, why was Jesus’ welcoming of children (Mark 10:13-16) countercultural?
options: Children were considered unclean and excluded from religious gatherings
Children were often neglected and not regarded as important in society
Children were usually taught by priests separately
Children were considered adults from birth
questions.correctAnswer: Children were often neglected and not regarded as important in society
questions.explanation: In ancient Jewish culture, children had low social status and disciples rebuked those bringing children, but Jesus affirmed their value (Mark 10:13-16).

questions.question: Fill in the blank: According to Mark 10:21, Jesus told the rich man to 'sell whatsoever thou hast, and give to the _____.'
options: poor
priests
Pharisees
temple
questions.correctAnswer: poor
questions.explanation: Jesus instructs the man to give to the poor as a demonstration of detachment from riches (Mark 10:21).

questions.question: True or False: In Mark 10:18, Jesus agrees with the man’s use of the title 'Good Master' without correction.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Jesus questions why the man calls Him good, saying only God is truly good (Mark 10:18).

questions.question: What is the theological significance of the blind man Bartimaeus' healing in Mark 10:46-52?
options: It symbolizes spiritual sight and following Jesus
It demonstrates Jesus’ power over death
It fulfills a prophecy from Isaiah about the Messiah
It shows the rejection of Gentiles
questions.correctAnswer: It symbolizes spiritual sight and following Jesus
questions.explanation: Bartimaeus receives physical sight and then follows Jesus, symbolizing the receiving of spiritual insight and discipleship (Mark 10:52).

questions.question: According to Mark 10:24-25, what metaphor does Jesus use to describe the difficulty for rich people to enter the kingdom of God?
options: A camel going through the eye of a needle
A lion entering a sheepfold
A mountain moving into the sea
A river drying in the desert
questions.correctAnswer: A camel going through the eye of a needle
questions.explanation: Jesus uses the hyperbolic metaphor of a camel passing through a needle’s eye to illustrate the impossibility of riches hindering salvation (Mark 10:25).

questions.question: In Mark 10:42-44, Jesus contrasts Gentile rulers with His followers. What concept of leadership does He promote?
options: Servanthood and humility
Absolute authority and control
Political dominance
Ritual purity
questions.correctAnswer: Servanthood and humility
questions.explanation: Jesus teaches that true greatness is serving others, contrasting the lordship of Gentile rulers (Mark 10:42-44).

questions.question: How does Mark 10:33-34 foreshadow the Passion narrative?
options: By predicting Jesus’ betrayal, suffering, death, and resurrection
By describing a victorious military campaign
By recounting Jesus’ birth
By detailing the building of the temple
questions.correctAnswer: By predicting Jesus’ betrayal, suffering, death, and resurrection
questions.explanation: Jesus foretells His upcoming betrayal, condemnation, mockery, crucifixion, and resurrection, directly foreshadowing the Passion (Mark 10:33-34).

questions.question: Which theme in Mark 10 reflects a broader New Testament emphasis on the reversal of worldly values?
options: Many that are first shall be last and the last first
The importance of strict legalism
The permanence of social class
The superiority of wealth
questions.correctAnswer: Many that are first shall be last and the last first
questions.explanation: This theme of reversal challenges worldly status and is echoed throughout the New Testament (Mark 10:31).

questions.question: What is the significance of Jesus’ question in Mark 10:38 about drinking the cup and being baptized with His baptism?
options: It signifies participating in His suffering and mission
It refers to literal drinking ceremonies
It means joining the Jewish priesthood
It indicates a political revolution
questions.correctAnswer: It signifies participating in His suffering and mission
questions.explanation: Jesus uses 'cup' and 'baptism' metaphorically to ask if James and John are prepared for His suffering and sacrifice (Mark 10:38).

questions.question: Fill in the blank: In Mark 10:29-30, Jesus promises those who have left all for His sake will receive _______ and eternal life.
options: an hundredfold now in this time
immediate riches
political power
earthly fame
questions.correctAnswer: an hundredfold now in this time
questions.explanation: Jesus promises abundant earthly blessings and eternal life for those who sacrifice for the gospel (Mark 10:29-30).

theological.title: Mark Chapter 10 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Mark Chapter 10 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: According to Mark 10, what is Jesus' teaching on divorce and remarriage?
options: Putting away a wife and marrying another is adultery
Divorce is allowed for any reason
Remarriage after divorce is acceptable without consequence
Divorce was commanded by God in the New Testament
questions.correctAnswer: Putting away a wife and marrying another is adultery
questions.explanation: Mark 10:11-12 clearly states that whoever divorces and marries another commits adultery. This teaching aligns with Matthew 19:6-9 where Jesus emphasizes the permanence of marriage, Genesis 2:24 which establishes the union as one flesh, Malachi 2:16 where God hates divorce, and 1 Corinthians 7:10-11 which advises believers not to divorce.

questions.question: What reason does Jesus give for Moses allowing divorce in Mark 10?
options: Because of the hardness of people's hearts
Because God commanded it
To punish unfaithful spouses
To protect women's rights
questions.correctAnswer: Because of the hardness of people's hearts
questions.explanation: Mark 10:5 reveals that Moses allowed divorce due to human hardness of heart. This explains the concession and is consistent with Exodus 21:10-11, Deuteronomy 24:1-4 which Moses legislated, Jeremiah 3:8 where God laments divorce, and Matthew 19:8 where Jesus reiterates this reason.

questions.question: How does Jesus describe the original design of marriage in Mark 10?
options: Male and female created by God to become one flesh
A temporary arrangement until circumstances change
A civil contract approved by religious leaders
Two separate individuals bound by agreement
questions.correctAnswer: Male and female created by God to become one flesh
questions.explanation: Mark 10:6-8 affirms God's original creation of male and female to become one flesh in marriage. This agrees with Genesis 1:27, Genesis 2:24 describing one flesh union, Ephesians 5:31-32 which links marriage to Christ and the church, and Matthew 19:4-6 where Jesus references this design.

questions.question: What attitude towards children does Jesus express in Mark 10?
options: Children should be allowed to come to Him, for the kingdom of God belongs to such as these
Children should be kept away from holy matters
Children are unimportant in the kingdom of God
Only adults can receive salvation
questions.correctAnswer: Children should be allowed to come to Him, for the kingdom of God belongs to such as these
questions.explanation: Mark 10:14-15 shows Jesus' displeasure at the disciples rebuking those bringing children, affirming the kingdom belongs to those with childlike faith. This corresponds with Matthew 18:2-4 about humility, Luke 18:16-17 where Jesus welcomes children, Psalm 127:3 valuing children as a heritage, and 1 Timothy 4:12 encouraging believers to be examples regardless of age.

questions.question: In Mark 10, why does Jesus question the man who calls Him 'Good Master'?
options: Because only God is truly good
Because Jesus did not want to be called good
Because the man was disrespectful
Because Jesus was testing him
questions.correctAnswer: Because only God is truly good
questions.explanation: Mark 10:18 reveals Jesus' affirmation of God's unique goodness, emphasizing His divine nature and distinguishing Himself from human teachers. This is consistent with Luke 18:19 where Jesus says the same, Psalm 25:8 affirming God's goodness, James 1:17 declaring God as the giver of every good gift, and John 10:11 where Jesus claims to be the good shepherd.

questions.question: What is the one thing Jesus tells the rich man to do to inherit eternal life?
options: Sell all he has, give to the poor, take up his cross, and follow Jesus
Keep all his possessions and follow the commandments
Build a temple and give offerings
Pray daily and fast
questions.correctAnswer: Sell all he has, give to the poor, take up his cross, and follow Jesus
questions.explanation: Mark 10:21 commands the rich man to sell all, give to the poor, and follow Jesus as the path to eternal life. This teaching aligns with Matthew 19:21, Luke 18:22 emphasizing detachment from wealth, 1 Timothy 6:17-19 warning against riches, and Philippians 3:7-8 valuing Christ over possessions.

questions.question: What metaphor does Jesus use in Mark 10 to describe how difficult it is for the rich to enter the kingdom of God?
options: It is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle
It is like climbing a tall mountain
It is like finding a needle in a haystack
It is like crossing a raging river
questions.correctAnswer: It is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle
questions.explanation: Mark 10:25 uses the camel and needle metaphor to illustrate the impossibility of self-reliant rich entering God's kingdom. This is consistent with Matthew 19:24, Luke 18:25, Proverbs 30:8-9 warning of riches, and 1 John 2:15-17 about not loving the world.

questions.question: How does Jesus respond when his disciples ask, 'Who then can be saved?' in Mark 10?
options: With men it is impossible, but not with God: for with God all things are possible
Only the poor can be saved
Only the righteous can be saved
No one can be saved
questions.correctAnswer: With men it is impossible, but not with God: for with God all things are possible
questions.explanation: Mark 10:27 teaches salvation is impossible by human means but possible through God’s power. This is consistent with Ephesians 2:8-9 on salvation by grace, John 3:16 emphasizing faith, Romans 8:31 affirming God's omnipotence, and Philippians 4:13 showing strength in God.

questions.question: What promise does Jesus give to those who leave all for His sake and the gospel's in Mark 10?
options: They will receive a hundredfold now and eternal life in the world to come
They will be free from persecution
They will become wealthy
They will immediately enter heaven
questions.correctAnswer: They will receive a hundredfold now and eternal life in the world to come
questions.explanation: Mark 10:29-30 promises abundant blessings and eternal life for those who sacrifice for Christ. This aligns with Luke 18:29-30, Hebrews 11:6 affirming reward for faith, Matthew 19:29, and Romans 8:17 about being heirs with Christ.

questions.question: What does Jesus predict will happen to Him as He goes up to Jerusalem in Mark 10?
options: He will be delivered to chief priests, condemned, mocked, scourged, killed, and rise again on the third day
He will be crowned king
He will perform many miracles
He will establish a new kingdom immediately
questions.correctAnswer: He will be delivered to chief priests, condemned, mocked, scourged, killed, and rise again on the third day
questions.explanation: Mark 10:33-34 records Jesus’ prediction of His passion and resurrection. This is consistent with Isaiah 53:3-7 prophesying the suffering servant, Psalm 22 describing crucifixion, Matthew 16:21, and Luke 24:7 on resurrection.

questions.question: What request do James and John make to Jesus in Mark 10?
options: To sit one on His right hand and the other on His left hand in His glory
To be healed of sickness
To cast out demons
To be given authority over all tribes
questions.correctAnswer: To sit one on His right hand and the other on His left hand in His glory
questions.explanation: Mark 10:35-37 shows James and John asking for places of honor. This request reflects human misunderstanding of glory and power, contrasting with Jesus' teaching on servant leadership in Mark 10:42-45, Philippians 2:5-8 on humility, and Matthew 20:25-28 on servant kingship.

questions.question: How does Jesus define true greatness among His followers in Mark 10?
options: Whoever wants to be great must be a servant of all
Whoever accumulates the most followers
Whoever has the most possessions
Whoever holds the highest position
questions.correctAnswer: Whoever wants to be great must be a servant of all
questions.explanation: Mark 10:43-44 teaches servant leadership as true greatness, reversing worldly notions. This agrees with Matthew 23:11-12, Luke 22:26, John 13:12-17 where Jesus washes disciples’ feet, and Philippians 2:3-7.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the Son of Man's coming according to Mark 10?
options: To serve and give His life as a ransom for many
To be served and glorified
To establish an earthly kingdom
To overthrow Roman rule
questions.correctAnswer: To serve and give His life as a ransom for many
questions.explanation: Mark 10:45 states that Jesus came not to be served but to serve and give His life as ransom, emphasizing substitutionary atonement. This is supported by Isaiah 53:5-6, 1 Timothy 2:5-6, Romans 5:8, and John 10:11.

questions.question: How does blind Bartimaeus respond when Jesus calls him in Mark 10?
options: He casts away his garment and comes to Jesus
He hesitates and stays seated
He asks for proof before coming
He ignores the call
questions.correctAnswer: He casts away his garment and comes to Jesus
questions.explanation: Mark 10:50 shows Bartimaeus immediately responding in faith and obedience, symbolizing repentance and eagerness, similar to the parable of the lost sheep (Luke 15:4-7), and the call to discipleship (Matthew 4:18-20), and Acts 9:6 where Saul responds to Jesus' call.

questions.question: What does Jesus say to Bartimaeus after he asks to receive his sight?
options: Go thy way; thy faith hath made thee whole
Sit down and wait patiently
Your sight will return in time
You must follow the law first
questions.correctAnswer: Go thy way; thy faith hath made thee whole
questions.explanation: Mark 10:52 highlights faith as the means of healing, a theme consistent with numerous healing accounts such as Matthew 9:22, Luke 17:19, John 9:25, and Hebrews 11:1 on faith’s power.
